metadata.title: CVE-2019-9433 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In libvpx, there is a possible information disclosure due to improper inputvalidation. This could lead to remote information disclosure with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed forexploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-80479354

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvpx1 - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
vpx-tools - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvpx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
